page.title: 13ARCHAEOLOGY IN DACRE.
page.content: ST.ANDREWS CHURCH,DACRE,stands on the site of a Saxon monastery mentioned by Bede in his history.This is the subject of the archaeological exploration.A drain on the south side of the church and made of Roman sandstone blocks, was connected with this monastery.The site,except the drain will be filled in.Some walls and floor of a priests house were found in the orchard.Items found on the north side include rings a styles,pottery glass,beads and a quern stone for grinding corn it is hoped to keep them at Dacre.The dig 1981-85 has involved many archaeologists Dr.Roger Leach (1.5yrs.)and Miss Rachel Newman (2.5YRS.).The finds were discovered 9 feet down other finds include gardens and seeds.some 180 burials have taken place on the site.
